This topic is intended to describe the main features for the WH Responsive output from the user perspective.
Usually, it should contains only 'concept' topics to describe the features. Task topics about how to use these concepts will be linked in the 'How' to section.
body.p: The WebHelp Responsive variant features a very flexible layout, is designed to adapt to any screen size, and is available for DITA document types. The WebHelp Responsive with Feedback variant also includes a feedback system that allows your users to make comments and allows you to manage and reply to them. This section contains information about the default layout and main features of the WebHelp Responsive output.

body.p: WebHelp Responsive output can be generated by using the DITA Map WebHelp Responsive or DITA Map WebHelp Responsive with Feedback transformation scenario.
WebHelp Responsive output can be generated by using the webhelp-responsive transformation type in your DITA to WebHelp script.
